meanings.definition: Having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something
meanings.sent1: She is able to solve complex problems quickly.
meanings.sent2: He is a very able student and always completes his assignments on time.
meanings.sent3: Even though he is young, he is able to outsmart his older siblings in games.
meanings.sent4: Her determination made her as able as a superhero in overcoming challenges.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks made him appear able to defy the laws of physics.

meanings.definition: Having considerable skill, proficiency, or intelligence
meanings.sent1: The artist is able to create beautiful paintings with ease.
meanings.sent2: She is an able pianist, captivating the audience with her music.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel was able to outwit the mischievous raccoon.
meanings.sent4: His sharp mind made him as able as a detective in solving mysteries.
meanings.sent5: The skilled archer's aim was as able as a laser beam hitting the target.

meanings.definition: Capable of being done or achieved
meanings.sent1: With hard work, anything is able to be accomplished.
meanings.sent2: The project seems difficult, but it is definitely able to be completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat believes it is able to catch the elusive red dot on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The dream of traveling the world became as able as a reality in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The seed, once planted, is able to grow into a mighty tree with time.
